result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amber J Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amber J Smith was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/27/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 4. DRI ct 3. DISM cts 1, 2. 2 years probation. State requesting 60 days to submit restitution order. Argument. Statement by DE. DNA ordered. DE reminded of future out of county court dates. 

  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 4.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1, 2  . 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count # 3  .

  Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   4
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  2 years, cc to 18CF1661, 18CM1515

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription

-Random UA and BA testing at a minmum of once per week
-Provide DNA sample

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Restitution: (State has 60  days to prepare an order)

-Shall not live where alcohol or illegal drugs are present
-Shall not enter any Walmart Store or Dollar General Store

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 4
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time already served:  0
-Days credit if revoked: 0

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K
